title: Adjective collection 1
sentences: My house is very big and has many rooms.
This book is a bit small but very interesting.
Your car is very fast; I love it.
The bus is very slow in the mornings.
Today I am very happy because I don't have to work.
She is sad because she lost her keys.
El examen de español fue muy
The Spanish exam was very easy for me.
It is very difficult to learn so many new verbs.
I bought a new phone yesterday.
This building is very old and needs a renovation.
That restaurant is very expensive to have dinner every day.
La ropa en este mercado es muy
The clothes in this market are very cheap.
The food is very tasty (rich), thank you very much.
He is a very poor but very generous man.
The bathroom is very clean now.
My car is very dirty because of the rain.
The window is open and a lot of noise is coming in.
The shop is closed on Sundays.
Watch out, the coffee is very hot.
I prefer to drink cold water when it's hot.
This movie is very fun/funny; I like it a lot.
La clase de hoy fue un poco
Today's class was a bit boring.
My sister is very intelligent and gets good grades.
Your friend is very nice/friendly; I like him.
That path is very long to go on foot.
I have very short hair this summer.
He is a very strong boy because he does a lot of sports.
I feel a bit weak today; I don't have energy.
I am very tired after working ten hours.
My grandfather is sick and is in the hospital.
dictionary:
Grande - Big
Pequeño/a - Small
Rápido/a - Fast
Lento/a - Slow
Feliz - Happy
Triste - Sad
Fácil - Easy
Difícil - Difficult
Nuevo/a - New
Viejo/a - Old
Caro/a - Expensive
Barato/a - Cheap
Rico/a - Tasty / Rich
Pobre - Poor
Limpio/a - Clean
Sucio/a - Dirty
Abierto/a - Open
Cerrado/a - Closed
Caliente - Hot
Frío/a - Cold
Divertido/a - Fun / Funny
Aburrido/a - Boring
Inteligente - Intelligent
Simpático/a - Nice / Friendly
Largo/a - Long
Corto/a - Short
Fuerte - Strong
Débil - Weak
Cansado/a - Tired
Enfermo/a - Sick
